page.title: 05Church life in Lydlinch
page.content: Enter the decorative,iron gates of the churchyard which,when closed form a cross and walk up through an avenue of pollarded plane trees to reach the church. The church in Lydlinch is dedicated to St.Thomas a Beckett.It was probably during the first flush of enthusiasm for this saint (murdered in December 1170)that the church here was founded.The first recorded Rector was one Henry Haddon in 1303.The present building was erected in 1479 with the two-bay north arcade and vestry being added in 1838. The parish no longer has its own rector.Because of the national shortage of clergy,about 10 years ago it was put into the care of the Vicar of Sturminster Newton who is also responsible for the churches at Stock and Kings Stag.
